com.sony.smarttennissensor.service

Interface IHost

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IHost.Stub

    public interface IHost
    IHost is the interface offerred by the Host App. The host app is the intermediary app between the sensor and the client app(s). The clients are uniquely differentiated by their process id obtained from android.os.Binder.getCallingPid()

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  IHost.Stub
      Local-side IPC implementation stub class.

    • Method Detail

      • getSensorState

        int getSensorState()
                   throws android.os.RemoteException
        Returns the status of the host app.
        Returns:
        0 = DISCONNECTED
        1 = CONNECTING
        2 = CONNECTED
        3 = LIVE MODE
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • connect

        void connect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice device,
           ISensorConnectListener sensorConnectlistener,
           IOnSensorChangeListener sensorChangeListener,
           IOnSensorStateChangeListener sensorStateChangeListener)
             throws android.os.RemoteException
        This is an asynchronous call requesting the host to connect to the BluetoothDevice. Listeners registered by this client previously will be overwritten. If client A successfully connects to sensor A, and later client B calls connect with the same sensor A, client B will receive ISensorConnectListener.onConnect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice) If client A successfully connects to sensor A, and later client B attempts to connect with sensor B, then sensor A will be disconnected, and upon connecting with sensor B, client A will be informed of this change through its IOnSensorChangeListener.
        Parameters:
        device - The device must be a Smart Tennis Sensor and must have already been paired from the Android system menu. Cannot be null.
        sensorConnectlistener - This callback will receive the result of the connect call.
        sensorChangeListener - If the sensor device is changed by another client, this callback will be called. This will be unregistered in disconnect()
        sensorStateChangeListener - Shares changes in the state of the sensor. This will be unregistered in disconnect()
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
                throws android.os.RemoteException
        Requests the host to disconnect the bluetooth connection with the Smart Tennis Sensor. The host will actually disconnect the sensor only when all the clients have disconnected. This will unregister all the listeners registered in connect(android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice, ISensorConnectListener, IOnSensorChangeListener, IOnSensorStateChangeListener) and setConfig(Config, IResultListener, IOnConfigChangeListener).
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • getRacketList

        java.util.List<RacketModel> getRacketList()
                                          throws android.os.RemoteException
        Gets the master racket list of the compatible racket models.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • getConfig

        Config getConfig()
                 throws android.os.RemoteException
        Returns:
        The Config being used by the host app. May have been set by another client. Returns null if none has been set.
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • setConfig

        void setConfig(Config config,
             IResultListener resultListener,
             IOnConfigChangeListener changeListener)
               throws android.os.RemoteException
        Sets the config asynchronously. Internally performs network operations. Must be called only in connected state, else will result in IResultListener.onResult(int) with be invoked. If another client has set the config already, it is ok to skip this call. If however no client has previously configured the sensor and startLiveMode is called, ILiveModeListener.onError(int) will be invoked. If a client sets the config, and another client later sets a different config then IOnConfigChangeListener.onConfigChanged(com.sony.smarttennissensor.service.Config) will be invoked.
        Parameters:
        config - The config must have a racketId of a RacketModel obtained from getRacketList(). Must not be null.
        resultListener - The listener that receives the result asynchronously.
        changeListener - Invoked when the config is changed later by another client. This listener is unregistered in disconnect().
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • startLiveMode

        void startLiveMode(ILiveModeListener listener)
                   throws android.os.RemoteException
        Attempts to start live mode. If the host is already in live mode with another client, this client still needs to make this call to receive shot data. Config should have been set previously.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to receive shot related information. This will be unregistered in stopLiveMode().
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException

      • stopLiveMode

        void stopLiveMode()
                  throws android.os.RemoteException
        If this client is the last client to call stopLiveMode, the host will internally stop live mode. This will also unregister the ILiveModeListener set in startLiveMode(com.sony.smarttennissensor.service.ILiveModeListener).
        Throws:
        android.os.RemoteException
